(I haven't gotten around to posting the revised profiles of the new bodies of 
the three Brotherhood members below, but anyone who fought them at the CF 
prior to this battle, you should notice Sun Crusher and Reflector are a 
couple feet taller and all of them look a lot meaner

Also, someone post damage for the base.  If not Firefox, then please IR since 
she be in command)

Vehement/Sun Crusher/Reflector:



Vehement watched the few Maximals gathering  together.  Like insects.  About 
to be crushed under Vehement's foot.  But suddenly Vehement felt sick and he 
hurt all over has his optics unvoluntarily focused in on Hot Rod.

The blood colored optic sensors turned to a light emerald almost immediately 
and Vehement knew he was no longer under control of his own body, though he 
could watch from his optics and feel his limbs and everything else move, but 
he couldn't control, almost like a dream.  He knew it was divine intervention.

"You," Vehement heard his own body say in a voice like his only a tad bit 
deeper as a finger pointed at Hot Rod, "will fight me now.  And die."

An eight foot long broadsword appeared in Vehement's right hand, and he could 
feel his hand close around it tightly as rage that wasn't his began boiling.

---

Sun Crusher watched an enemy fire upon Reflector but turned back to Iron 
Raptor.  He could feel something inside of her.  Something of power.  Though 
Vehement had been taken over, Sun Crusher could feel a voice in his mind.

< /BRING IT TO ME/ >, < /DO NOT FAIL, FOR THAT WHICH I GIVE CAN BE TAKEN 
AWAY, DIPLOMACY OR FORCE, NONE MATTER, SIMPLY GET IT/>

The voice hurt, but not as much as it had in his weaker body.  He looked to 
Iron Raptor's chest with a glare.  He had to get whatever it was that was 
beneath it.  His master knew, but the servant didn't.

"You." he said, moving his glare to Iron Raptor's optics.  "You will give me 
what is in your chest.  The source of power.  The..."

< /THE MATRIX/ > the voice roared in his head, causing more pain.

"Give me the Matrix, heathen scum, and we will leave for good and never 
return to this unholy place.  On our word as servants of the Chaos-Bringer.  
If not, your bodies will rest at our feet battered and broken beyond 
recognition and restoration.  The choice for you is the easy path, or the 
difficult path.  But you heathens lack hope and intensity.  Thou shalt not 
win unless you give us what we want."

---

Reflector had been busy, but he still seen Kluster come out of the battered 
base with a weapon of war.

"Heathen fool." he muttered under his breath, firing off a single bolt of 
optic energy at one missile, the other one impact with his chest plate.  He 
flipped back through the air a few feet, straightening out though.  In his 
old body he thought, he'd have drawn mech-fluid like a pathetic heathen.  But 
now he was strong.  Sadly, the weakest of his cadre.

His despair had been replaced with a deep unfathomles emotion that seemed to 
be hate and a hunger for destruction, death, and total chaos.

He raised a wrist mounted with twin barrels, a barrage of sonic waves 
launching out at Kluster's midsection.
